Katie Britt releases TV ad slamming ‘radical liberals’ on abortion — ‘I’m not gonna take it’

By Dylan Smith
February 11, 2022 




Share
FacebookTwitterEmail






(Katie Britt for AL Senate/YouTube)
Thursday, 2022 Republican U.S. Senate candidate Katie Britt released her campaign’s first broadcast TV advertisement in which she highlights her stance on abortion.
In the 30-second spot, Britt blasts “radical liberals” who support the right to an abortion during the final month of pregnancy.
“I’m Katie Britt. As a Christian conservative mother, I know that life is God-given,” says Britt in the ad. “I also know I’ve had about enough of radical liberals lecturing us about following science while being OK with taking the lives of innocent babies in the ninth month of pregnancy. Where I’m from, that’s called murder – and this mama, I’m not gonna take it. I approved this message because saving babies starts with sending more pro-life moms to the U.S. Senate.”


Watch:

In a release announcing her TV advertisement, Britt presented scientific evidence supporting her stance that life begins at conception.
The candidate pointed to the fact that an unborn child’s heartbeat can be detected as early as five weeks after conception. Additionally, she outlined that at the 15th week of pregnancy, a child inside the womb is capable of experiencing pain.
Britt also cited quotes from national left-wing figures such as U.S. Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.), U.S. Department of Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg and Texas gubernatorial candidate Beto O’Rourke, who each publicly declined to support a ban on third trimester abortions.
In a statement, Britt detailed her position that being pro-life includes advocating for policies that support and enhance the child’s life “from the womb to the workforce.”
“Education is the key to opportunity, which is at the heart of the American Dream. Each child in Alabama deserves to have a top-notch education so that they can land a good-paying job and support a family of their own right here at home one day,” sated Britt. “Zip code should never define opportunity for any Alabamian, and I will work to ensure every child in our great state can thrive in a safe, strong community. I am a Mama on a Mission to make the future bright for our children and our children’s children.”
Dylan Smith is a staff writer for Yellowhammer News. You can follow him on Twitter @DylanSmithAL
